tweets.text: #Water firms discharged raw #sewage into rivers and coastal waters in England more than 400,000 times last yr, says @EnvAgency.  How did they manage to get away with this behaviour  so long? Is it the need to keep bills down? @AnglingTrust @angling_times @CraigBennett3

What was the point of a Green Summit @AndyBurnhamGM if the rivers of NW England are treated as little more than open sewers? These data represent a complete failure of environmental regulation @EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgencyNW @unitedutilities

tweets.text:
And now we know why government have been so busy over the last couple of days.

In 2019 water companies spent over 3,100,000 hours, on over 400,000 occasions dumping sh*t into our rivers and seas.

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly?

https://t.co/sUsBYs5msz

Makes very depressing reading but we suspect things are much worse than the figures show. The @EnvAgency  have a bizarre way of counting spills. For example in 2020 the @RiverChess experienced 50 spills on consecutive days, they counted it as 1 spill. https://t.co/1AXYE2A3a0

Can @BarnetCouncil take action to stop illegal bonfires on land occupied by Pointalls Ltd., Squires Lane. They are a private company with no authority to burn commercial waste.
Concerned residents mistakenly think a fire is on LLP & üò≤ @LondonFire cut OUR padlocks! @EnvAgency

urls.title: Event duration monitoring ‚Äì lifting the lid on storm overflows
urls.description: On today's blog we look into the 2020 Event Duration Monitoring Data, which is fundamental to understanding and improving the environment.¬†

tweets.text:
Storm overflows performance data to inland and coastal waters has been published for all water companies in England.

For information on storm overflows and a link to the full data and a summary of the key statistics, read our blog post: https://t.co/51zRnT2fSi https://t.co/cLtFlAR7jt

Martin Hughes and his wife were flooded on Boxing Day 2015

He tells us his story of what it‚Äôs like to be flooded and shares his advice for others üëáüèº 

Know what to do in a flood: https://t.co/whMiqucyL6 #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/b52BSUBbky

Today the  @EnvAgency and @DefraGovUK have fail to point out the 50 days of sewage discharge in 2020 and 62 days already in 2021 and rising into the River Chess are all un-permitted, they are a breach of permit.

urls.title: What is a storm overflow and how do they work?
urls.description: Heard of a storm overflow but not sure what it is? Watch this to find out what they are, why they operate and what we do to minimise their impact on the wate...

tweets.text:
What are storm overflows, and why do we use them?

Storm overflows play a role in preventing sewage from entering our homes or streets during periods of heavy rain or storms.

Watch our video to find out more about storm overflows: https://t.co/VBJFNTBAVE

We are responding to a serious fish kill at Newton-Le-Willows #StHelens. Our officers & @sthelenscouncil are investigating the cause & taking action to avoid any further fish deaths

Our thanks go to the fast-acting members of the public who reported this to us on 0800 80 70 60

M6 J12 to J13 a eagle eyed @HighwaysWMIDS who was monitoring the CCTV cameras notice the occupants of a Passat dumping rubbish in a ERA bay.  We intercepted the vehicle M6 J14 to J15 and escorted them back clear their rubbish up.  Details passed to @EnvAgency. 5419 https://t.co/5tWwYYiaDZ

tweets.text:
*Proud Agent alert*

Our creative team has been hard at work (as ever!) with @EnvAgency on a new animation. It explains what storm overflows are and how we can all do our bit to help the #environment.

Give it a watch here: 

https://t.co/V5mJgSle7D
A glorious day for natural flood management work at Backstone Beck and #Ilkley Moor with @bradfordmdc @IlkleyOf #nfm https://t.co/uUzUzJMqs4 https://t.co/t6u4qJGxaB

Chose the right day to get my line manager on site! Work progressing well at Backstone Beck and the wildlife was a bonus! @bradfordmdc @Bradford_CROW @EnvAgencyYNE @moorsforfuture @SCORE_NSR @daleslandnet https://t.co/pigw10herp

Over 750 properties in Kent are now better protected from flooding, thanks to the Hythe Ranges Sea Defence scheme.

We worked in partnership with @DefenceHQ to deliver this project and saved 1,600 tonnes of carbon.

Watch the full video: https://t.co/yAFA23MBe1

#FCERM https://t.co/oMP8DM6Q8L
@LLPasture @barnet_rebel @BarnetCouncil @LondonFire @EnvAgency As if the air quality was not bad enough already by the North Circular. So selfish. @RossSHouston is this in West Finchley?
